title: Dutch Woman Who Joined ISIS, Sexually Abused Yazidi Slave In Syria, Jailed
content: A Dutch court on Wednesday sentenced a woman to 10 years in prison for joining Islamic State in Syria and keeping a Yazidi woman as slave.
summary: A Dutch court on Wednesday sentenced a woman to 10 years in prison for joining Islamic State in Syria and keeping a Yazidi woman as slave.

title: Father, Stepmother Convicted Of Pakistani Girl's Brutal Murder In UK
content: The father and stepmother of Sara Sharif, a 10-year-old girl who was found dead in her home in Britain, were on Wednesday convicted of her murder after a trial which heard harrowing details of her treatment before her killing.
summary: The father and stepmother of Sara Sharif, a 10-year-old girl who was found dead in her home in Britain, were on Wednesday convicted of her murder after a trial which heard harrowing details of her treatment before her killing.

title: Trump Plans Major Reshaping Of US Policies Within Hours Of Taking Office
content: President-elect Donald Trump is planning a blizzard of more than 25 executive orders and directives on his first day in office on Jan. 20 as he seeks to dramatically reshape U.S. government policy on issues from immigration to energy.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump is planning a blizzard of more than 25 executive orders and directives on his first day in office on Jan. 20 as he seeks to dramatically reshape U.S. government policy on issues from immigration to energy.

title: Afghan Taliban's Minister For Refugees Killed In Kabul Blast: Nephew
content: The Afghan Taliban's acting minister for refugees, Khalil Rahman Haqqani, has been killed in a blast in the country's capital Kabul, his nephew Anas Haqqani said on Wednesday.
summary: The Afghan Taliban's acting minister for refugees, Khalil Rahman Haqqani, has been killed in a blast in the country's capital Kabul, his nephew Anas Haqqani said on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: India, West, And Why 'Narrative Sovereignty' Matters
content: In this digital age, where perceptions shape reality, safeguarding narrative sovereignty is crucial. Anything less risks leaving a nations destiny in the hands of those who neither share nor serve its interests.
summary: In this digital age, where perceptions shape reality, safeguarding narrative sovereignty is crucial. Anything less risks leaving a nations destiny in the hands of those who neither share nor serve its interests.

title: Tomb Of Ousted Syrian President Assad's Father Set Ablaze
content: The tomb of ousted Syrian president Bashar al-Assad's father Hafez was torched in his hometown of Qardaha, AFP footage taken Wednesday showed.
summary: The tomb of ousted Syrian president Bashar al-Assad's father Hafez was torched in his hometown of Qardaha, AFP footage taken Wednesday showed.

title: Afghan Minister, Haqqani Network Founder's Brother, Killed In Suicide Blast
content: The Afghan minister for refugees was killed on Wednesday in a suicide explosion at the ministry's offices in the capital Kabul, a government source told AFP.
summary: The Afghan minister for refugees was killed on Wednesday in a suicide explosion at the ministry's offices in the capital Kabul, a government source told AFP.

title: Elon Musk To Buy Penthouse Next To Trump's Home For $100 Million: Report
content: Notably, Musk has been spending time at President-elect Trump's estate, Mar-a-Lago, and has even brought his children along for holidays.
summary: Notably, Musk has been spending time at President-elect Trump's estate, Mar-a-Lago, and has even brought his children along for holidays.

title: Best Books Of 2024: The Most Recommended Reads Of The Year
content: Its that time of year again  and we've invited 30 of our writers, from fields as disparate as wildlife ecology and mathematics to literature and politics, to share their best books of of 2024.
summary: Its that time of year again  and we've invited 30 of our writers, from fields as disparate as wildlife ecology and mathematics to literature and politics, to share their best books of of 2024.

title: Were Israeli Tanks Spotted Outside Damascus? A Fact Check
content: Israeli airstrikes have recently targeted several locations in Syria, destroying weapons and military facilities.
summary: Israeli airstrikes have recently targeted several locations in Syria, destroying weapons and military facilities.

title: Tokyo Sees 4-Day Work Week To Aid Families Amid Record Low Fertility Rate
content: Japan's fertility rate had reached a record low in June after witnessing a fall for many years, even though the government has made an effort for young people to get married and start families.
summary: Japan's fertility rate had reached a record low in June after witnessing a fall for many years, even though the government has made an effort for young people to get married and start families.

title: The Trial Of A King: How An Ancient Royal Ritual Promotes Peace In Cameroon
content: Chatter muffled as members of a secret society, masked and garbed in honey-coloured robes, entered the court of Foumban, the historic capital of a centuries-old kingdom nestled in hilly northwestern Cameroon.
summary: Chatter muffled as members of a secret society, masked and garbed in honey-coloured robes, entered the court of Foumban, the historic capital of a centuries-old kingdom nestled in hilly northwestern Cameroon.

title: UK's Aristocratic Lawmakers Prepare For Life After The Lords
content: UK hereditary lawmaker Richard Fletcher-Vane, better known as Lord Inglewood, will soon no longer commute the few hundred miles from his country house in northwest England to the House of Lords in London -- and he is not happy about it.
summary: UK hereditary lawmaker Richard Fletcher-Vane, better known as Lord Inglewood, will soon no longer commute the few hundred miles from his country house in northwest England to the House of Lords in London -- and he is not happy about it.

title: Bangladesh Court Once Again Rejects Bail Plea Of Chinmoy Krishna Das: Report
content: A Bangladesh court on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of Chinmoy Krishna Das, a Hindu priest and spokesperson of the Bangladesh Sammilit Sanatan Jagran Jote, who has been arrested and jailed by the local authorities on charges of sedition.
summary: A Bangladesh court on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of Chinmoy Krishna Das, a Hindu priest and spokesperson of the Bangladesh Sammilit Sanatan Jagran Jote, who has been arrested and jailed by the local authorities on charges of sedition.

title: Ukraine Hits Russian Border Regions, Sets Oil Depot Ablaze
content: Ukraine attacked Russian border regions with missiles and drones early Wednesday, sparking a fire at an oil depot and damaging an "industrial facility", officials said.
summary: Ukraine attacked Russian border regions with missiles and drones early Wednesday, sparking a fire at an oil depot and damaging an "industrial facility", officials said.

title: Toppling Of Syria's Assad Was Result Of US-Israeli Plan: Iran's Khamenei
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Wednesday that the toppling of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was the result of a plan by the United States and Israel.
summary: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Wednesday that the toppling of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was the result of a plan by the United States and Israel.

title: More Than 50% Chance Of La Nina In Coming Months: Global Weather Office
content: There is more than a 50% chance of La Nina developing in the next three months, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) said on Wednesday, but if it does it will be relatively weak and short-lived.
summary: There is more than a 50% chance of La Nina developing in the next three months, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) said on Wednesday, but if it does it will be relatively weak and short-lived.

title: Video: 2 Tourists Die After Massive Tree Collapses In Bali's Monkey Forest
content: Two tourists died in a tree collapse at the popular Monkey Forest tourist attraction in Ubud, Bali on Tuesday.
summary: Two tourists died in a tree collapse at the popular Monkey Forest tourist attraction in Ubud, Bali on Tuesday.

title: The Israeli Jews Who Spied For Iran In Biggest Infiltration In Decades
content: Israel's arrest of almost 30 mostly Jewish citizens who allegedly spied for Iran in nine covert cells has caused alarm in the country and points to Tehran's biggest effort in decades to infiltrate its arch foe, four Israeli security sources said.
summary: Israel's arrest of almost 30 mostly Jewish citizens who allegedly spied for Iran in nine covert cells has caused alarm in the country and points to Tehran's biggest effort in decades to infiltrate its arch foe, four Israeli security sources said.

title: The Key To Success? Scientists Say It Starts With Belief In Growth
content: Analyzing data from over 1,500 participants aged 13 to 77, researchers found that individuals with a positive outlook are more driven and determined to achieve their goals.
summary: Analyzing data from over 1,500 participants aged 13 to 77, researchers found that individuals with a positive outlook are more driven and determined to achieve their goals.
